docs.title: Home
docs.text: geopycat is a python package to manage metadata and data of geocat.ch. geocat.ch is a modified instance of the opensource project geonetwork.

docs.title: Backup geocat
docs.text: geopycat provides a CLI script to generate backups of geocat.ch. In order to successfully run this script, you should have admin rights and be able to connect to the PostgreSQL database of geocat.ch.

docs.title: Database connection
docs.text:
You can specify the username and password for connecting to the database in environment variables. If not, the script will prompt for credentials.

In a .env file

DB_USERNAME=username
DB_PASSWORD=password

docs.title: Running on UNIX system
docs.text:
geocat_backup [-env] [-o] [-m] [-u] [-g] [-s] [-db-user] [-db-password]

-env: int or prod
-o: output folder
-m: do not bakcup metadata
-u: do not bakcup users
-g: do not bakcup groups
-s: do not bakcup subtemplates
-db-user: database username
-db-password: database password

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
The package requires python 3

Using pip - install from github

pip install git+https://github.com/benoitregamey/geopycat.git

From swisstopo network - through proxy

"C:\Program Files\ArcGIS\Pro\bin\Python\envs\arcgispro-py3\Scripts\pip3" install --trusted-host github.com --proxy=proxy-bvcol.admin.ch:8080 git+https://github.com/benoitregamey/geopycat.git

Install an older version

pip install git+https://github.com/benoitregamey/geopycat.git@version
